column1: Hey all! Long time lurker. <e1>I just had this thought pop into my</e1> head as I <e2>begin my </e2>journey. <e3>I definitely have a drinking</e3> problem - not as in I blackout when I drink, <e4>but when the time comes, I can and will drink enough to get </e4>drunk - I have never been one to have a glass of wine and call it a night. 2 beers? Nah. I'll have 6, maybe 10.In the past, I was a \fun drunk\" - but I noticed over the past year that getting drunk was no longer fun. It made me feel miserable both during drinking and after drinking. I'm not really sure how to describe the feeling. I get agitated

Just wondering if you're anything like me.  I  got diagnose with GAD, I had lost control of my mind.  That's the way I like see it.But before that it was the physical <e1>symptoms</e1> that sent <e2>me over the edge</e2>.  To this day <e3>i have a hard time dealing with them </e3>.   I did go to the ER and after blood work, head and neck CT scan, EKG, cancer screening.  Nothing.  But I'd like to know what send you all over the edge, I feel like with anxiety something trigger it and made us go down here. For me <e4>the symptoms of head sensations</e4> thay creep up on me and <e5>make me dizzy or feel like I have vertigo</e5>.  Having to feel like I can't take a deep breath, so I can breath normally, and pins and needles feeling.  Most of these I experience every day and almost all day.

But never completely. I've been married 8 years my partner is very loving but <e3>can't meet my sexual desires or stamina</e3>.I <e4>masturbate as much a six times or more a day and have sex</e4>. I have not cheated but I wish I could have more sex with others. Is their anyone like that so frustrated.

<e1>I've been depressed</e1> since I was 6 years old. <e2>My primitive mind tried to kill myself before I was even out of kindergarten by getting wasps to sting me to</e2> death, and it failed. Ever since that, <e3>I've always been reluctant to end my life</e3> but it's always been in the back of my mind.Now, <e4>I haven't spoken to anyone in over 100 days</e4>. Staying alone with just my own thoughts to accompany me every day is really driving me insane. I know this isolation isn't the real issue, it's just a product of the lifelong depression. This is where it's taken me.<e5>For the first time since that first </e5>attempt, <e6>death really doesn't seem so bad</e6>. It can't be too different to how things are now.

i just dont have anything left in my life that would be worth living hopefully <e1>Austria soon changes some </e1>laws , <e2>i really would prefer having a peaceful </e2>death and <e3>not having to swallow a whole box of sleeping pills</e3>

My girlfriend who, despite<e1> being with her a short </e1>time, has <e2>worked her way into my heart very </e2>deep. But when she is around her family, she is viciously mean to me. Beyond anything any sensible person would consider joking. The worst part is that she knows I'm very depressed and she still hurts me with little regard. I just am so tired of feeling hurt all the time...<e3>she left me</e3>. <e4>Life is terrible</e4>

So I've barely eaten today at all. My husband has actually noticed I don't eat when I'm especially anxious. But I've also noticed that certain things like ice cream sound great. But I can't even fathom forcing myself to eat anything actually nutritious. Does this happen to anyone else?

Has anybody here stopped reading after the depression got worse? <e1>I used to read a </e1>lot and <e2>it used to help me get away from</e2> reality, but now <e3>I just can't </e3>concentrate. <e4>It's hard to</e4> study, but it's something I have to do. I haven't read a book in... Maybe 2 or 3 years... This isn't me... <e5>I'm on antidepressants for a year and a half and it's not getting better</e5>. <e6>I'm just starting to get more and more side  effects</e6>... It's the middle of the night, and I cannot sleep. <e1>I've never talked to anyone about what I'm about to </e1>write, <e2>so I'll be posting this on an throwaway </e2>account.When my son was 6, <e3>his mother was ran over by a drunk </e3>driver. <e4>She died. </e4>Shortly after the accident, my son stopped talking. He refused to go into therapy. Eventually he started talking to me, but only to me. He never talked to strangers, not a single word.Almost a year later, when he started school, he still wouldn't talk. He was the \awkward kid\" and <e5>was bullied </e5>because <e6>he didn't talk. </e6>At all. Not a single word. When he started his new school on 7th grade

Just like the title says. If it had been me, everyone's life would be easier. My mom wouldn't be at her wits end with what to do with me and she'd have her husband here to help her through it. My dog wouldn't have to deal with an owner who's depressed and mad all the time. My job would find someone new and fresh, not someone bitter and angry all the time. My \friends\" wouldn't have to pretend to worry about me. My ex wouldn't have to wonder if I'm still not over him or not. My dad still had so much going for him. He had his job.

Earlier today, I ended up in a negative situation where I got really upset. However, instead of blowing up/having an episode, <e1>I removed myself from the situation</e1> and <e2>was able to calm myself down with deep breathing techniques</e2> and support from my mom. <e3>I'm usually really bad at being able to control my outbursts and emotions when I get upset</e3>, so <e4>this is a big step for me<e4>. \nBPD is difficult and exhausting - but days like today remind me that I can get through this.

I'm 28 and <e1>have been off ADHD medication for about ,12 years</e1>...<e2>it's been hell tbh, mind constantly racing, very exhausting</e2>...<e3>I don't like the meds though</e3>, <e4>they slow me down too much and make me feel sick</e4>. How are you doing with out meds?I'm functional with my daily tasks, but my racing mind and inability to sit and focus long term is a living hell.

So, something that has been on my mind lately, as well as in general is how to be motivated now that I am more conscious of my temper and how I act when i am angry. <e1>I used to walk around pissed off in general</e1>, <e2>using how I felt about things as a way to get myself motivated and get shit done</e2>. <e3>This was especially useful when I was younger and had just started school</e3>, <e4>as the thought of what people might say if i quit was enough to keep me getting out of bed</e4>, etc. <e5>Now that I've gotten older and a bit more established</e5>, <e6>it's not as simple to become motivated anymore</e6>, nor do i want to walk around pissed off around my two children. Still, I can't help but feel hollow or empty now, and when I am free to stew in my feelings, or work myself up it feels good. Honestly, i miss it a lot sometimes despite knowing better. I guess the end game here is to learn how to manage it better and all that but I am still not really able to do that.Just wanted to share my thoughts this week.

I've been dealing with suicidal ideation since 2013. I'm tired of all of this. I'm sick and fucking tired of it all. <e1>I'm not going back to the psych ward for the 4th time</e1>. <e2>I won't burden my family with bills again</e2>. It's over for me.
I get PVCs and PACs, and had an \attack\" of sorts in April while I was just doing sit-ups and push-ups.Now I get really anxious while walking

I recently had Intravenous Immunoglobulin treatment for the third time to cure [a disease that I have](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/PANDAS). It's been 2 days and the side effects are kicking in. I have a headache that won't go away even with steroids and I'm shaking and feel very hot and weak. 30 minutes ago, I was scared that my side effects will develop into the rarer and more severe ones, like meningitis or Stevens-Johnson Syndrome. <e1>I cried loudly</e1> because <e2>I was really scared</e2> and <e3>my parents came in and yelled at me to stop crying</e3>, because <e4>nothing is going to happen</e4>. I told them that they were making it worse and that I just wanted to cry and <e5>they threatened to turn the internet off</e5> (I know how spoiled I sound. It's the only thing I have because there is nothing else I can do and I can't leave the house.) <e6>to stop me reading about the side effects</e6>. Now, I'm really scared that I'm gonna die and all my friends are asleep. I don't want to kill myself, but <e7>this is the only place I know where I can get support from kind internet strangers</e7>, so <e8>I'm posting here. Sorry.,</e8>

I always have vivid dreams. Too vivid for my liking. I have several in one night. <e1>I'm afraid to sleep</e1>. as <e2>I always wake up in tears now.</e2> Sometimes <e3>they cause sleep paralysis,/e3> and to me, that makes me want to sleep even less as I'm afraid. <e4>I get anxious every time I think of sleeping and I hate it.</e4> Does anyone know of anything I could do to eradicate dreams all together or to reduce the amount of dreams I get?

My family doesn't understand, they have a perfect child who did amazing in school, really successful, etc. Then they have me. Doing shit in school, barely making it through my final year, probably won't get into uni or college, mental issues, difficult child. 

I feel like I'm a burden to everyone. My friends, my parents, my boyfriend, everyone. I'll be happy for a few days and then I drop again. I hate it...it just never goes away and <e1>I'm pretty sure I've made things worse</e1> by <e2>opening up to people that there's something wrong</e2>. I only found out a month ago but I've been fucked for so long. I'm always depressed, moody, I frequently get burst of rage out of nowhere, I misinterpret a situation and make things worse, been losing friends since I was 8. I keep making mistakes and I suffer for it. 

I hate it all....

and im about to fall asleep again I would sleep for 3-4 hours, stay woke for a couple of hours, then go back to sleep, and repeat I mean its better than not getting enough sleep i guess, but it is a bit strange because when i went from toking every half an hour or so to cold turkey in the past(obviously, this isnt my first time), <e1>i used to not be able to get any sleep at all for the first few days</e1>.<e2>Im on day 2 by the way Im taking 2000 mg of fish oil daily, which is equivalent to 1000 mg of omega 3 according to the label</e2>, so that might have something to do with this.

So I think a lot of my anxiety could be reduced by practicing more self forgiveness, which in this context means beating myself up less for awkward social interactions. That being said, I think there's danger in being too forgiving of one's faults; how could we grow if we couldn't take an honest assessment of ourselves? I think the danger arises when you are so freely self forgiving that you become blinded to when you might make serious social mistakes. What social infractions, if you will, warrant self forgiveness and when is it appropriate to analyze and ruminate?

I can't pay attention, I can't focus on anything, I'm fidgety and I'm quick to anger. I feel like it's made my ADHD extra intolerable. My boss pulled me aside today and said she needs me to stay seated during a two hour presentation and to me that is insanity. I can sit for 20 minute before I feel like I'll burst. Hopefully it passes and I calm down. I quit Wellbutrin about a month ago after being on it for a year. <e3>I'm back on it now</e3> because <e4>my friends said they think it's best for me</e4>. I'm trying not to beat myself up about it or think too much about the issue that I let get to me last night. I dosed this morning and I'm attempting to see how long I can go without since I'm off work today. I haven't been more than five or six hours without in months-since I started, really, so I'm not really sure what to expect. I've no plans to go completely CT, just to see how far I can make it through the day, and then I will keep my dose low and continue on with my taper regimen.

Hey guys,So I am on Vyvanse 50 mg and I have run out of my prescription. <e1>Due to travel</e1>, <e2>I will be getting my prescription refill in 2 days</e2> and <e3>have already been off of it for 2 days</e3>. Needless to say <e4>I feel like dog shit</e4>. <e5>My jaw is tensed</e5>. I feel constantly sleepy and unstimulated. Yesterday I must have cycled through 3-4 video games and couldn't stick to one. My temper and anxiety have been through the roof and I cannot stop shaking my God damn leg.Now I know that there is dependency there and as such withdrawal which can explain the physical fatigue and tense jaw. All the other stuff is just my ADHD symptoms coming back in full force (how was I living before??)Anyway, so far I've tried to just breathe, stay calm in general and hunker down. I've been drinking coffee to help stimulate me but I was wondering if you guys have any tips? I constantly feel tired and irritated. Anything I can do to make these next two days go more smoothly?

I really can't put my finger on it. I don't feel right mentally. I guess I'm feeling a bit on edge, tense, anxious, the usual. But I've been bored every single day for like two weeks now and I almost feel disconnected. My anxiety has been revving up again and I'm experiencing physical symptoms like lack of appetite, nausea, stomach upset, etc (just wonderful when you're emetephobic). For some reason I'm stuck looking at each day as an opportunity for something to go wrong and afraid that I won't make it through the day. I'm going through a lot of transition right now (moving, college, etc), so maybe that's why? I feel out of control and not like my normal self at all. I don't feel like doing anything or seeing anyone.Can anyone relate? Will this go away?

My heart's beating like crazy. I feel like vomiting or crying or both. I really didn't need this on my day off. I think my sex drive might have withdrawn for the next week or so. Hey, i will try to keep this short.Been using concerta almost a year now. Had some side effects first but they were manageable, started at 18mg but went >for 36mg very fast.
